meanings.definition: Unpleasant or disgusting in appearance or taste
meanings.sent1: The old, moldy sandwich looked even yukkier under the bright light.
meanings.sent2: The garbage left out for days was getting yukkier by the hour.
meanings.sent3: The yukkier the food looked, the more the raccoons seemed to enjoy it.
meanings.sent4: The smell in the room was so yukkier than a skunk's spray.
meanings.sent5: The slimy texture of the spoiled milk made it even yukkier than expected.

meanings.definition: More unpleasant or disgusting than something else
meanings.sent1: The rotten eggs smelled yukkier than the spoiled cheese.
meanings.sent2: The dirty alleyway was getting yukkier with each passing day.
meanings.sent3: The yukkier the situation became, the more they laughed at the absurdity.
meanings.sent4: The taste of defeat was yukkier than any bitter medicine.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds made the storm look even yukkier than predicted.
